class_notes: Writing Atlanta - In connection with Atlanta Studies, an open access peer-reviewed journal, this course explores writing in relation to the city and the challenges of writing about place. By considering the special case of Atlanta, and writing as an invention emerging from the practice of many disciplines, we will consider how the past, present, future, and planning of a city is represented.  In additional to reading great writing and practicing our own writing, production, and fieldwork, we will consider the challenges of managing a publication by contributing to the nuts and bolts work of producing the Atlanta Studies Journal.
course_description: Course topics will vary but always will be focused on writing, rhetorical composition and analysis, or literacy skills. Topics possible include a variety of options such as journalistic writing, non-fiction, debate, argumentation, persuasion, digital writing, among others.
